result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo Escobedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time. Sentence credit of 1 day was granted if imposed.
Consecutive to: Case 15CM1182

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

No Contact with Wendy D. or her residence, Misty W. or her residence, Scott s. or Ernie E. (except for contact through court order for visitation purposes). Provide DNA Specmen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through and complete Alliance Counseling. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
To be performed as a condition of probation, as directed by agent on each case.
Consecutive to: Cases 15CF1182 & 16CM700

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo Escobedo
